actions.text: Referred to House Committee on the Judiciary.

official_title: A bill to amend section 611 and 627 of title 28, United States Code, relating to the retirement of the Director and Deputy Director of the Administrative Office of the U.S. Courts and the Director of the Federal Judicial Center.

summary.text: Sets forth provisions governing retirement benefits for the Director and the Deputy Director of the Administrative Office of the United States Courts and the Director of the Federal Judicial Center. States that such officers may elect to receive an annuity equal to 80 percent of the salary of the office at the time of their retirement, provided such officers have served: (1) at least 15 years and attained the age of 65; (2) at least 14 years and attained the age of 66; (3) at least 13 years and attained the age of 67; (4) at least 12 years and attained the age of 68; (5) at least 11 years and attained the age of 67; or (6) at least 10 years and attained the age of 70 years.

titles.title: A bill to amend section 611 and 627 of title 28, United States Code, relating to the retirement of the Director and Deputy Director of the Administrative Office of the U.S. Courts and the Director of the Federal Judicial Center.
